page.title: 10TODAY'S AGRICULTURE
page.content: THE AREA NORTH OF INNSWORTH IS LOW LYING LEVEL LAND. THE SOIL VARIES FROM CLAY TO ALLUVIUM BEING IN THE VALLEY OF THE RIVER SEVERN. OVER THE LAST 10 YEARS THERE HAS BEEN AN AMALGAMATION OF FARMS, WITH SPARE FARMHOUSES BECOMING AVAILABLE FOR RESIDENTIAL USE. FARMS WHICH ONCE HAD 60 COWS NOW HAVE 180. AUTOMATIC ABREAST MILKING PARLOURS ARE USED. THESE HOLD 10 COWS AT A TIME. DURING THE SUMMER COWS ARE FED ON GRASS; DURING THE WINTER ON SILAGE, HAY AND CONCENTRATES. THE MILK YIELD PER COW HAS INCREASED BY 25%. THE YIELD OF GRASS PER ACRE HAS INCREASED BY 25%, BUT THE NUMBER OF COWS IS NOW BEING REDUCED BECAUSE OF E.E.C. QUOTAS. SILAGE IS SELF FED BY THE USE OF AN ELECTRIC FENCE. LAB- OUR COSTS HAVE BEEN REDUCED BY 50% BE- CAUSE OF NEW EQUIPMENT AND MACHINERY.
